comments.html: What would you recommend for "bonus points" testing tool? We could check Terraform/Ansible exit status, but that would only find syntax errors. What if our commit breaks connectivity, how do we find it? PyATS? Batfish?
comments.name: Pavel Glushkov

comments.html:
Batfish is designed to prevent errors that break connectivity.

-- a Batfish developer (join us on Slack if you want to chat)
comments.name: Ratul

comments.html:
@Pavel: Running "terraform plan" will give you way more than just syntax check, but if you're concerned about broken connectivity, you could write an Ansible playbook (or whatever else) that would log into various servers (it's easy to deploy them in the cloud, I've heard) and run connectivity tests.

Finally, it's the cloud, and it's supposedly infinite, so just spin up a second copy of your environment, and run sample transactions.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak
